Windlord:

windlord sighed and said =E2=80=9Cbut is something that must be =
done to protect it=E2=80=9D

From: Sandy Panico 
Sent: Friday, July 08, 201=
1 6:29 AM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Changing times (Cue: All=
 Maximals & Autobots)




Instinct suddenly floods Tucson's logic circuits =
as Talon's kiss excites his inner spark.  He could not help but lean into h=
er body with a passionate embrace and a romantic kiss to her lips.  His bre=
athing quickens with passion as his chest rests up against Talon's.  Throug=
h his armor it was possible to feel the pulsation of his spark.

Outside, Q=
uickstride puts his muzzle on Windlord's shoulder with a heavy sigh.

"Same=
 here, this is the only home I knew of too.  I'll miss everything about thi=
s planet.  I just wish there was a way we could stay here in secrecy so we =
don't upset the balance of things."

Perpetually on the move and constantly=
 busy. 

On Jul 8, 2011, at 1:04 AM, Airshadow Nightstar <airly2002@hotmail=
.com> wrote:


    
  Talon / WIndlord:


  Talon smiled and kissed Tucson.=



  ******************************

  Windlord=E2=80=99s face turned serio=
us and said =E2=80=9CI reallywill miss that planet when we leave, I born he=
re... You know, before the neo beast wars start, I was here alone.=E2=80=9D=


  From: Sandy Panico 
  Sent: Thursday, July 07, 2011 9:47 AM
  To: nbwrp=
g@yahoogroups.com 
  Subject: Re: Changing times (Cue: All Maximals & Autob=
ots)




  Tucson smiles at the sound of Talon's knock and opens the door f=
or her, bowing politely while offering his hand in a gentleman manner.

  "=
 Talon, thank you for joining me.  Please, come in."

  Tucson had never ex=
perienced true courtship before but something in his spark was showing him =
how.  It was as if another part of his spark was being activated for the fi=
rst time but whatever it was, he welcomes the new sensation gladly.  Now he=
 knew how happy Rodimus felt when he was around Nightlight and the tremendo=
us love he experiences every day.  Now it was Tucson's turn to show Talon h=
ow much he loves her, which to him was infinite.  

  " Talon I have to con=
fess, before I met you I didn't know what courtship was and how to go about=
 it.  Then that first time when I tried to tell you that I really admired y=
ou, I was at a loss as how you would perceive my intentions.  But now, than=
ks to you, I was able to come out of my shell and for that I will always lo=
ve you with every inch of my spark.  And now, here we are, together again a=
nd ready for the next step."

  He gently takes Talon's hands into his own.=


  " Talon, will you show me the way?"

  Outside, the mare and the filly =
shake their heads and trot off in the other direction, thanks to Windlord's=
 help.  Quickstride heaves a sigh of relief.

  " That was close, thanks I =
owe ya one, buddy.  I am so not ready for a serious relationship right now.=
  Especially when it comes to attracting Natural life.  It just wouldn't be=
 right ya know.  Leo Primes right, this isn't our world to upset.  If anyth=
ing it needs to be preserved.  Ecology is so important to an evolving plane=
t and there is no need to upset the balance.  I wonder how much of Cybertro=
n is left, and if we still have our world to go home to.."

  He looks over=
 to Windlord as he sits down in the grass, watching bees buzzing around ope=
ned water blossoms, gathering nectar to convert into honey.  




  Perpetu=
ally on the move and constantly busy. 

  On Jul 7, 2011, at 1:49 AM, Airsh=
adow Nightstar <airly2002@...> wrote:


      
    Talon/Windlord

=
    Talon slowly walked towars Tucson=E2=80=99s quarterts and she glenty hi=
t the door, and waited for Tucson.


    **********************************=
*****************************

    Windlord started laught for a while then=
 he regain composture and scream in ultrasonic way trying to scare of the w=
ild horses.




    From: Sandy Panico 
    Sent: Wednesday, July 06, 2011 =
10:17 PM
    To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
    Subject: Re: Changing times (C=
ue: All Maximals & Autobots)




    Ooc: gotchya.

    BIC:

    Tucson no=
ds and turns to get ready for a little alone time with Talon.

    Yet he t=
urns back to Wheelie.

    " If that's what you want, that's fine by me, Wh=
eelie.  But keep in mind, it doesn't hurt to have a friend as well as a com=
rade by your side. I learned that many vorns ago when I started working wit=
h the Autobots.  And yes war is a difficult time and we can not weaken our =
defenses but, it doesn't mean we have to be anti social either.  Strength i=
s in numbers.  That was one of Master Yokitron's words."

    Tucson backs =
into his private quarters and closes the door softly.

    Perpetually on t=
he move and constantly busy. 

    On Jul 6, 2011, at 10:20 PM, "adamsafran=
" <adamsafran@...> wrote:


        

      > 
      > Meanwhile, in =
Tucson's quarters, Tucson looks down at Wheelie and realizes that he had no=
 idea of his change of status, seeing that the last time they were together=
 Tucson was just an average comrade, just a slight larger than Wheelie. He =
heaves a sigh and kneels down to Wheelie.
      > 
      > " I was going to=
 give you a lecture and a warning but I realize you just comeback online af=
ter many vorns . You were not aware of my change of status to Prime office =
and perhaps mistook me for my previous status. I'll let it go this one time=
, Wheelie but keep in mind that a Prime is a Prime no matter who they are. =
All right, you're free to roam the Auto base now. Please try not to get sen=
t to my office again, okay?"
      > 
      > With a smile of understanding=
, Tucson opens the door to let Wheelie go on his way. Once having let Wheel=
ie free, he waits for Talon with a light hearted smile on his face.
      >=
 

      OOC - Uhm, I posted Wheelie leaving your quarters and he never ent=
ered them in the first place, then him heading out. So there's no way he co=
udl have been there, and he wouldn't have gone back over to them! So will p=
ose this as taking place out in the ship corridors. Thanks!

      Also, I =
appreciate your posting, but it's sort of weird how you have each and every=
 character of your's coming up, then doing something to me, then knowing ea=
ch and every thing that happened to each adn every other one that did, and =
them all having the exact same opinions over on everyone as everyone else d=
id. 

      Also, unless your characte ris asuperior officer who's going to=
 emphatically order him to do something, please don't pose him going somewh=
ere far else after you for a setup. Since it's hideously unrealistic for hi=
m to go back to Tuscon's quarters twice now as you've posed him doing when =
he's not especially fond of Tuscon, nor him following someone else as well =
when I posd him trying to leave. So, if going to go somewhere with him, ple=
ase give me a cahnce to respond to it ahead of time. It's two times you pos=
ed him extensively going with your characters when it was not in character =
for him to do so.

      If your characters have had interactions with him =
in the past or things I should know of, let me know? As I have no idea wher=
e Wheelie interacted with Tuscon or how they would have remotely konwn of o=
ne another, and you've posted repeaetdly that Tuscon knows him from the pas=
t, when I have no idea of that.

      So again, if they've had interaction=
s as NPC's, let me know their generic history so I can respond appropriatel=
y. If he's going to be told to go somewhere wtih someone, either give me a =
chance to respond appropriately if he does or not, or make it something lik=
e a specific order in the case someone is a superior. And it's also rather =
weird how your characers come up from nowhere, all have the exact same opin=
inos and back one another up to the hilt on thier interactions and everythi=
ng. I feel kind of wedged into a corner by this.

      I understand I'm ne=
w to the gruop and you've been here much longer, I just feel rather hemmed =
in on the character with what you're doing and am confused as to how things=
 operate, and how you have all of your alts congregating and making me feel=
 pressed into a corner.

      Anyways, sorry if this is coming fof a bit t=
oo negative, thank you very much for the welcome here and for playing wtih =
me and interacting with Wheelie.

      <Back In Character>

      Wheelie,=
 having met Tuscon up in the hall, gazes over at him, "What is this with al=
l of you? You're back and forth whatever I do. This is what Prime is, just =
a rank? It seems like it's just sort of dank. We had four of five in a room=
, that's not a level of doom and gloom."

      Then, walking away from Tus=
con, but looking behind, "I'm glad you're good with all of your friends, co=
ngrualtions on the promotion and to whatever ends. But we, we were never fr=
iends. We went back and forth in our ways, and I respect your orders for th=
ese days. But we're not here to have fun, we're here to fight and run and g=
un."

      Wheelie leaning against the wall, "I'll work wtih you, if you d=
o tell, but I'm a soldier, and war is hell. I'd prefer to keep my own advic=
e, and I appreciate your friends, they try and be nice. But don't have them=
 ganging up on me and telling me what to do, or how you'll react, or on you=
'll I chew. So by al lmeans, give me some space, we're here to fight for th=
e future of our race."
